intro: Restio gaudichaudianus var. microstachyus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
